Module nl.naturalis.common
Package nl.naturalis.common

Class NumberMethods

java.lang.Object
nl.naturalis.common.NumberMethods
public final class NumberMethods extends Object
Methods for working with Number instances.

  • Method Details

    • isInteger

      public static boolean isInteger(String str)
      Returns whether the specified string represents a valid integer. This method delegates to BigDecimal.intValueExact() and is therefore stricter than Integer.parseInt(String).
      Parameters:
      str - The string
      Returns:
      Whether it represents a valid integer

    • parseInt

      public static int parseInt(String s) throws TypeConversionException
      Parses the specified string into an Integer. Throws an TypeConversionException if the string is not a number or if the number is too big to fit into an Integer. This method delegates to BigDecimal.intValueExact() and is therefore stricter than Integer.parseInt(String).
      Parameters:
      s - The string to be parsed
      Returns:
      The Integer representation of the string
      Throws:
      TypeConversionException

    • isPlainInt

      public static boolean isPlainInt(String s)
      Returns whether the specified string represents a plain, non-negative integer, consisting of digits only, without plus or minus sign, without leading zeros, and fitting into a 32-bit integer.
      Parameters:
      s - The string
      Returns:
      Whether the specified string is a valid, digit-only integer

    • toPlainInt

      public static OptionalInt toPlainInt(String s)
      Returns an empty OptionalInt if the specified string does not represent a plain integer, else the integer parsed from the string.
      Parameters:
      s - The string
      Returns:
      An OptionalInt plain, non-negative integer, consisting of digits only, without plus or minus sign, without leading zeros, and fitting into a 32-bit integer, or an empty OptionalInt

    • isShort

      public static boolean isShort(String str)
      Returns whether the specified string represents a valid short.
      Parameters:
      str - The string
      Returns:
      Whether the specified string represents a valid short.

    • isPlainShort

      public static boolean isPlainShort(String str)
      Returns whether the specified string consists of digits only, without plus or minus sign, without leading zeros, and fitting into a 16-bit integer.
      Parameters:
      str - The string
      Returns:
      Whether the specified string is a valid, digit-only 16-but integer

    • toBigDecimal

      public static BigDecimal toBigDecimal(Number n)
      Converts a Number of unspecified type to a BigDecimal.
      Parameters:
      n - The number
      Returns:
      The BigDecimal representing the number

    • convert

      public static <T extends Number, U extends Number> U convert(T number, Class<U> targetType)
      Converts the specified number into a number of the specified type. Throws an TypeConversionException if the number is too big to fit into the target type.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of the number to be converted
      U - The target type
      Parameters:
      number - The number to be converted
      targetType - The class of the target type
      Returns:
      An instance of the target type

    • parse

      public static <T extends Number> T parse(String s, Class<T> targetType) throws TypeConversionException
      Parses the specified string into a number of the specified type. Throws an TypeConversionException if the string is not a number or if the number is too big to fit into the target type.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of Number to convert the string to
      Parameters:
      s - The string to be parsed
      targetType - The class of the Number type
      Returns:
      A Number of the specified type
      Throws:
      TypeConversionException

    • fitsInto

      public static <T extends Number> boolean fitsInto(Number number, Class<T> targetType)
      Returns whether the specified Number can be converted into an instance of the specified Number class without loss of information.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of Number to convert to
      Parameters:
      number - The Number to convert
      targetType - The type of Number to convert to
      Returns:
      Whether conversion will be lossless

      Returns the absolute value of an arbitrary type of number.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of the number
      Parameters:
      number - The number
      Returns:
      Its absolute value

    • isBetween

      public static boolean isBetween(int subject, int lowerBoundInclusive, int upperBoundExclusive)
      Returns whether subject lies within the specified range.
      Parameters:
      subject - The integer to test
      lowerBoundInclusive - The lower bound of the range (inclusive)
      upperBoundExclusive - The upper bound of the range (exclusive)
      Returns:
      Whether subject lies within the specified range

    • inRangeClosed

      public static boolean inRangeClosed(int subject, int lowerBoundInclusive, int upperBoundInclusive)
      Returns whether subject lies within the specified range.
      Parameters:
      subject - The integer to test
      lowerBoundInclusive - The lower bound of the range (inclusive)
      upperBoundInclusive - The upper bound of the range (inclusive)
      Returns:
      Whether subject lies within the specified range

    • getLastPage

      public static int getLastPage(int rowCount, int pageSize)
      Returns the zero-based number (a.k.a. index) of the last page, given the specified row count and page size (rows per page).
      Parameters:
      rowCount - The total number of rows (or elements) to divide up into pages (or slices)
      pageSize - The maximum number of rows per page (or elements per slice)
      Returns:
      The zero-based (a.k.a. index) number of the last page

    • getPageCount

      public static int getPageCount(int rowCount, int pageSize)
      Returns the total number of pages required for the specified row count, given the specified page size (rows per page). A.k.a. the number you should use as the to index in loops or list operations.
      Parameters:
      rowCount - The total number of rows (or elements) to divide up into pages (or slices)
      pageSize - The maximum number of rows per page (or elements per slice)
      Returns:
      The total number of pages you need for the specified row count

    • rowsOnLastPage

      public static int rowsOnLastPage(int rowCount, int pageSize)
      Returns the number of rows in the last page, given the specified row count and page size (rows per page). That's just rowCount % pageSize.
      Parameters:
      rowCount - The total number of rows (or elements) to divide up into pages (or slices)
      pageSize - The maximum number of rows per page (or elements per slice)
      Returns:
      The number of rows in the last page

    • emptyRowsOnLastPage

      public static int emptyRowsOnLastPage(int rowCount, int pageSize)
      Returns the number of empty rows in the last page.
      Parameters:
      rowCount - The total number of rows (or elements) to divide up into pages (or slices)
      pageSize - The maximum number of rows per page (or elements per slice)
      Returns:
      The number of unoccupied rows in the last page
